ArticleTitle.sentence: An isotype-specific activator of major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class II genes that is independent of class II transactivator.

event.clue: An isotype-specific activator of major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class II genes that is independent of class II transactivator.
An isotype-specific activator of major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class II genes that is independent of class II transactivator.

AbstractText.sentence: Patients with one type of major histocompatibility complex class II combined immunodeficiency have mutations in a gene termed class II transactivator (CIITA), which coordinately controls the transcription of the three major human class II genes, HLA-DR, -DQ, and -DP.

event.clue: Patients with one type of major histocompatibility complex class II combined immunodeficiency have mutations in a gene termed class II transactivator (CIITA), which coordinately controls the transcription of the three major human class II genes, HLA-DR, -DQ, and -DP.

AbstractText.sentence: However, the experimentally derived B-lymphoblastoid cell line, clone 13, expresses high levels of HLADQ in the absence of HLA-DR and HLA-DP, despite its mapping by complementation analysis to this group.

AbstractText.sentence: It was possible that one of the clone 13 CIITA alleles bore a mutation that allowed HLA-DQ, but not HLA-DR or -DP transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: Alternatively, another factor, distinct from CIITA, might control HLA-DQ expression.

event.clue: Alternatively, another factor, distinct from CIITA, might control HLA-DQ expression.

AbstractText.sentence: We report here that ectopic expression of CIITA cDNAs derived by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction from clone 13 do not restore expression of HLA-DQ in another CIITA-deficient cell line, RJ2.2.5.

event.clue: We report here that ectopic expression of CIITA cDNAs derived by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction from clone 13 do not restore expression of HLA-DQ in another CIITA-deficient cell line, RJ2.2.5.

AbstractText.sentence: In addition, no CIITA protein is detectable in clone 13 nuclear extracts.

event.clue: In addition, no CIITA protein is detectable in clone 13 nuclear extracts.

AbstractText.sentence: In contrast, somatic cell fusion between clone 13 and RJ2.2.5 restored expression of the HLA-DQ haplotype encoded by the RJ2.2.5 DQB gene.

event.clue: In contrast, somatic cell fusion between clone 13 and RJ2.2.5 restored expression of the HLA-DQ haplotype encoded by the RJ2.2.5 DQB gene.

AbstractText.sentence: Taken together, these data demonstrate the existence of an HLA-DQ isotype-specific trans-acting factor, which functions independently of CIITA.
